p: Deglucosylation of lignan glucosides by intestinal bacteria [ 133, 134] is the first step of lignan metabolism in the digestion track of mammals ( Section 2.2.3). In the laboratory, deglucosylation is used to determine total aglycon concentration ( Section 2.5.2) and to maximize the yield of aglycons in preparative purification ( Section 2.5.3).
